transcript.text: hi and welcome you're listening to the x
22 report my name is dave and this is
episode 845 a and today's date is
december 17th 2015 and the title this
episode is that Fed rate hike ushers in
the next phase of the economic collapse
now before I get started I just want to
make an announcement I just uploaded a
new interview with andy hoffman if you
go to the x 22 report spotlight youtube
channel you will see that video or you
can come over to the x 22 report com
site scroll down a little bit look over
to your right hand side you'll see the
video right there let's get right into
the economic collapse financial news now
we've been looking at a lot of economic
indicators and they're all pointing down
none of it is showing us that we're in
any type of recovery but so far and
everything that we looked at
manufacturing when we looked at retail
when we looked at housing when we look
at unemployment we are showing that
things are deteriorating quickly and if
we look at the philly fed it is
collapsed to a negative five point nine
percent missing their expectations of a
positive one and hitting its lowest
level since februari of 2013 new orders
have created two three year lows so when
we look at this entire situation nothing
has changed at this point even though
the Fed made its announcement and we
know the market rallied up to 200 plus
points or so well today it's down 200
plus points so nothing has been gained
but what we're seeing is the corporate
media the US government all clapping
their hands they've done it we are in a
recovery everything is settled we've
heard that before and everything is
going to go smoothly but we have to
remember we're going into an election
year in 2016 and during an election year
they're going to do whatever they
possibly can to make it look like
everything is absolutely fine we saw
this in 2008 until the very end right
before the elections and we're going to
see the same thing happen once again
they're going to lower the unemployment
rate we'll prob
get into the four is 4.8 4.9 they're
going to continually tell everyone how
we're in this incredible recovery that
we went from 2008 we created all these
jobs which there were no jobs created
actually we lost millions of people in
manufacturing and they're going to try
to convince us that the central banking
system has created all of this currency
brought us into recovery and now raise
the Fed fund rate by a quarter
percentage hara hara we are in a
recovery now this is all part of their
major illusion and what's very
interesting is that the bloomberg
consumer comfort survey found that
sixty-nine percent of the people had a
negative view of the state of the
economy and when you look at when people
were looking at the economy saying okay
it's good it's bad and things like that
there were times during 2015 where the
state of the economy was much higher
than it is today and the feds said
absolutely no we're not going to raise
the rates the Fed decided to raise the
Fed fund rate at the lowest point of the
economy which is kind of strange at this
time and the question is why did they do
it right now because what's happening
around the world what's happening here
in the United States they realize that
they cannot push this economy forward
any longer it's getting harder and
harder their statistical numbers don't
even match up to the real economic
indicators anymore they're so far apart
because everything that we've been
discussing makes no sense from what they
are saying and Paul Craig Roberts is out
there saying what does the rate hike
really mean and he wanted to say that it
means that the Fed has had time to
figure out that the effect of this small
rate hike would essentially be zero in
other words the small increases in the
target rate from a range of 0 2.25
percent
2.25 % 2.5 2.50 percent is insufficient
to set off any problems in the
derivative market stocks bonds housing
but we knew this we knew that this
wasn't really going to have an effect
and the question is why did they do it
they had to do it because the world was
looking at the central bank remember
when i said the central bank does not
want to be blamed for this collapse
because the central bank wants to rule
the world once again and start the
system completely over and if people
catch on that it's the central bank
that's causing all these problems this
wouldn't be possible so they had to
convince everyone and bring everyone
into this illusionary world that we are
in a recovery and this is exactly what
they just did this is a signal to
everyone that the next phase of this
collapse has begun because now they're
at the point where they're going to have
to raise it again and as they
continually raise it this is going to be
troublesome and they know this and this
is why we need to be prepared and ready
because they're ready to bring home this
event but Paul Craig Roberts went on to
say that the purpose of raising interest
rates is the choke off credit demand but
there was no need to choke off credit to
man because it was no demand for credit
and basically what he's saying is that
this whole rate hike is a complete fraud
the banking system as a whole does not
need to borrow add as it is sitting on
about 2.4 2 trillion in excess reserves
the negative impact of the rate hike
effects really only smaller banks that
are lending to consumers to other
businesses now if these banks find
themselves fully loaned up and in need
of overnight reserves to meet their
reserve requirement they will need to
borrow from a bank with excess reserves
thus the rate hike has the effect of
making smaller banks pay higher interest
to the mega banks in other words the
rate hike just facilitates more looting
by the one percent that is it now by
increasing the Fed fund rate this
eventually is going to implode the
financial system this one increase is
not going to do it we will see cracks we
will see things starting to fall apart
but again the US government the federal
reserve they can hide this with their
manipulation of what is really going on
and in back in June of 2014 the ECB cut
interest rates to negative so before
this the interest rate differential
between euro and the US dollar was just
about point two five percent and the US
dollar was yielding about point two five
percent while the deposit rate on the
euro was exactly zero this was kind of
significant the interest rate
differential was not enough to kick off
a complete flight of capital from the
euro to the US dollar to the US dollar
however when the ECB launched nerp
negative interest rates cutting its
deposit rate to negative 0.1% the rate
differential went up two point three
five percent and basically resulted in
vast quantities of capital fleeing euros
into dollars so there are over nine
trillion in borrowed US dollars sloshing
around the financial system and much of
it is parked in assets that are
denominated in emerging-market
currencies the very currencies that
imploded as the US dollar has rallied
this is the US dollar carry trade and it
is a larger in scope than economies of
Germany and Japan combined in short when
the ECB cut their rates to negative the
US dollar carry trade began to blow up
now the situation has worsened because
basically the Fed has raised the Fed
fund rate
and what this means is the differential
between euro and the US dollar has hit
point seven five percent this will
trigger a complete implosion of the nine
trillion u.s. dollar carry trade at this
point the nine trillion u.s. dollar
carry trade will implode triggering a
2008 type of an event so what is the
timeline of all this most likely this is
going to happen in six to twelve months
because as we know the Fed is saying
that they're going to be looking at the
Fed fund rate next year and they're
looking to raise it four more times are
they ever going to get to that most
likely no most likely what's going to
happen is they're going to say yes we're
going to be raising the rates they might
do it one more time another quarter of a
percentage but if everything goes as
planned the event will occur they will
never get to raising the rate and they
will blame this entire collapse on
another group or country all eyes will
be off of the central bank they have
just proven that they've recovered the

in the next phase now we're heading
towards that area of when they're
getting prepared and ready to push this
war forward now at this point since
everyone believes that we're in this

Saudi Arabia is saying that they're

there is about 40 crude tankers with

did something very odd they stopped they

headed back the way they came at least
three thirty seven thousand ton tankers
the vendome Street the Atlantic Starr
the antic Titan they have made you turns

we are now heading back West basically
all these tankers have no place to go
whatsoever because they're just

the prices now we know the US government
has just passed the omnibus bill there
was only one congressman who voted no on

our he's an American Republican
politician and he's the member of the
house of representatives from Arizona
since 2011 and he went on to say that he

he's saying the bill failed to defund

from being resettled in the country
until we have a system that can probably

you see something very interesting the

services truck drivers food processing
forestry and many other fields that
don't require any type of college
education companies will not have to
worry about them about the penalty

and then eventually all of these people

but what's very interesting and I
